question: Diagnostic sign of a fracture:

question: Nexus criteria is used for

question: Wolff's law states that:
exp: Wolff's law.- it states that by progressive bone deposition on to one surface (to compression site) and resorption from other (tension site), it is responsible for the gross changes in the shape of bones which occur during development and adaptation of bone to applied loads It refers to over all consequences for the whole bone of the sum of all the units of remodelling activity which are occurring throughout the bone. It has usually predominant osteoclastic activity at tension site and osteoblastic activity at compression site.

question: Which of following is not true about Traction-
exp: Option A and B - skeletal traction is always better than skin traction as the maximum capacity of weight which can be hanged is much more in skeletal traction. Skin traction can bear maximum of 5-7 kg weight while skeletal traction can bear upto 10-25% of body weight. Option C- skin traction is better is pediatric and old age patients as bones in old age are osteoporotic and in pediatric patients ossification centres are not yet fused and strength of bone is not enough to bear skeletal traction. Option D- K nail is not used for traction . K nail is a clover leaf shaped hollow rod used for internal fixation.
opa: Skeletal traction is better than skin traction in patient with Femur fracture
opb: Maximum weight which can be given in skeletal traction is 25% of body weight
opc: Skin traction is preferred in pediatric patients
opd: K-nail is used commonly to give skeletal traction

question: Instrument used in internal fixation of small bones as well as in Ilizarov's technique?
exp: Kirschner wires are sterile, sharp, smooth stainless steel pins, introduced in 1990 by Main kirschner. Diameter : 0.9 to 1.5 mm range. Uses of Kirschner wires: 1. Used in fixation of fractures of small bones and fractures in childrens 2. Used in Ilizarove method for fixation of the Ring. 3. Used in giving Tractions after fracture olecranon process. Kuntscher's nail: It is Kuntscher's clover leaf intra-medullary nail, also known as the K-nail. Use: fixation of femoral fractures. Steinmann pin is a stout straight steel rod of diameter ranging from 3-6 mm. Used for skeletal traction. Bohler's stirrup is used for holding Steinmann pin in skeletal traction.

question: Which of the following is ideal site for harvesting bone graft?
exp: Iliac crest is the ideal and most common site for harvesting bone graft. BONE GRAFT Ilium (Pelvis): This is an ideal source of primary 1st order bone graft because it is relatively subcutaneous, has natural curvatures that are useful in fashioning grafts, has ample cancellous bone and has coical bone of varying thickness. Removal of bone carries minimal risk and usually no significant residual disability. Posterior superior iliac spine is the best source of cancellous bone. Anterior iliac crest is the best source of bicoical and coico cancellous graft. Location according to age: Child- Tibial tuberosity Adults- Posterior superior iliac spine Obese- Anterior superior iliac spine

question: Mirel's criteria is developed for the evaluation of
exp: Mirel's Criteria For Risk of Pathological Fracture: 1 Mirel's developed a scoring system based on, the presence or absence of pain,the size, location, and radiographic appearance of the lesion to quantify the risk of impending pathological fracture in malignant lesion 2 So patients with maximum risk of pathological fracture are having lytic peritrochantric lesion involving >2/3 diameter with severe pain 3 Patients with < 7 score are observed, but those with 8 or more should have prophylactic internal fixation. Pathological Fractures may occur even with normal stresses if the bone has been weakened by a change in its structure Causes: osteoporosis, osteogenesis imperfecta , Paget's disease, bisphosphonate therapy) or through a lytic lesion (e.g. a bone cyst or a metastasis). FDG-PET CT is the gold standard for bone Metastasis. It occurs in abnormal bones. Mostly in elderly people. Fractures can be single or multiple occurs after tril injury. Pain in the case of a pathological fracture usually precedes the fracture. Pain can occur at the site before the fracture
